block.p: Gem Link in Sierra Leone Sierra Leone officials say documents show that a wanted rebel leader was using the diamond trade to pay for his rebellion.
Gem Link in Sierra Leone Sierra Leone officials say documents show that a wanted rebel leader was using the diamond trade to pay for his rebellion.
Mothers to March President Clinton says the Million Mom March today will show that the gun lobby ''is no match for America's moms.''
Mets Release Henderson Rickey Henderson, the career stolen base leader but a slumping hitter this season, was given his unconditional release.
Architecture and Law Herbert Muschamp examines a proposal to overhaul New York City's zoning laws.

Where It's Always Showtime Ever since King Kong climbed the Empire State Building, Manhattan has felt like one big movie set. Farther south, Nashville, home of small-town country dreams, is chasing a cosmopolitan image.

Old World, New Economy In a round-table discussion, the chief executives of six fast-growing companies celebrate the rise of European entrepreneurship and challenge governments to get out of the way of growth.
Tony Blair, Modern Guy The prime minister of England has put his nation on a modern track and remains popular.

Summer On the other side of the world: Sydney, a city of hedonism and culture, and host for the summer Olympics; Bhutan, the tiny Himalayan kingdom, is a trekker's paradise; Phuket, an island off Thailand, has great beaches.
The Do-Gooders' Doctrine When keeping the peace means resorting to force.
